creator: hzimmerman
title: Recording HD (720p) video in Max 7
materials_required: Final Cut Pro X (or similar video editing software)
description: This project guides you on how to record Jitter video output from Max 7 patches running on OSX in HD (720p) quality, ensuring the video is editable in programs like Final Cut Pro X and viewable via QuickView in the OSX Finder.
steps: Open the Cycle-delic patch in Max 7.
Ensure all parts of the patch that reference the initial 320 x 240 video format are changed to 1280 x 720 to generate HD video. This includes editing the [p stuff] object.
Adjust the "Center" pictslider parameters for HD video. Set the "Bottom" value to approximately 730 and the "Right side" value to around 1290.

Add a [jit.record] object with dimensions 1280 and 720 to record the Jitter matrix output from the [p stuff] object. Set the engine attribute to 'avf' and the codec to 'prores422'. Add [write 25.] and [stop] messages to control recording at 25 frames per second.
Click the [write] message box to specify the save location and name for the new movie. After the recording is complete, a prores422 Quicktime movie in 1280 x 720 quality will be created.
Use "File - New From Clipboard" to paste the provided Max code to generate the patch.
